item.title: Introduction
item.description: We begin by generating some synthetic data for a simple least squares regression model. set.seed(123) n <- 100 p <- 10 beta <- 1:p # beta is just 1 through 10. X <- matrix(rnorm(p * n), nrow=n) colnames(X) <- paste0("beta_", beta) Y <- X %*% beta + rnorm(n) If we only had the data (\(Y\) and \(X\)) to begin with, we could estimate the \(\beta\) using lm function to get the best least squares fit.
